flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: 1: PCB; 2: Solder; 3: White LEDs; 4: Wire; 5: 10kΩ resistor; 6: Switch (it can be a momentary switch); 7: Battery holder for 4 AA batteries; 8: 10μF Electrolytic capacitor; 9: 555 timer (NE 555).
lines.text_raw: 1: PCB; 2: Solder; 3: White LEDs; 4: Wire; 5: 10kΩ resistor; 6: Switch (it can be a momentary switch); 7: Battery holder for 4 AA batteries; 8: 10μF Electrolytic capacitor; 9: 555 timer (NE 555).

lines.text: 1: Wire clippers; 2: Soldering iron or gun; 3: Hot-glue gun; 4: Knife for stripping insulation from wire.
lines.text_raw: 1: Wire clippers; 2: Soldering iron or gun; 3: Hot-glue gun; 4: Knife for stripping insulation from wire.

lines.text: Solder all parts together on a small PCB according to the diagram at left.
lines.text_raw: Solder all parts together on a small PCB according to the diagram at left.

lines.text: By changing the value of R1 you can change the speed of the LED's blinking. You can also add a 10kΩ potentiometer trimmer instead of R1.
lines.text_raw: By changing the value of R1 you can change the speed of the LED's blinking. You can also add a 10kΩ potentiometer trimmer instead of R1.

lines.text: Here is a video of this project on YouTube.
lines.text_raw: [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m88koIIl-dc&feature=youtube_gdata|Here is a video] of this project on YouTube.

guide.summary: Make a high-power LED blink as a warning light, a robot eye or whatever else you might need.
guide.title: High-Power Blinking LED
